basics.name: Charles Desneuf
basics.label: Software Architect & Tech Coach Freelance
basics.summary:
After several years at Evaneos, from its startup phase to scale-up, I decided to become independent.

My goal is to help teams reach their full potential, to produce software that continuously meets their users' true needs, while maintaining a sustainable pace.

 I truly believe that it is the combination of real problems, an appropriate organization, a well-thought-out product, and quality tech that creates value for users. I view myself as someone who connects the various skills of my clients' teams, opens the doors to other ideas, to help them create the best possible solutions.

I do this by bringing a mix of technical and architectural skills, facilitation techniques, an interest for product management and an agile mindset.

work.name: Evaneos
highlights: Managing a team of 6 back-end and front-end developers
Working hand-in-hand with Product Managers to deliver the right features
Running the tech community of practices by organizing dojos and facilitating mini-conferences
Refactoring legacy code
Facilitating workshops for other teams and at the company level
work.summary:
As an Engineering Manager, I managed multiple teams, up to 6 front-end and back-end developers. Together, we worked on several critical parts of the company system, with projects varying from internal tools creation to user-facing systems and legacy remediation.

I also ensured that we worked hand-in-hand with our Product Manager, UX Designer, and Business People, by facilitating workshops and improving our workflows.

As a manager, I ensured the team members kept learning and growing in their roles by coaching them, giving them space to safely experiment, and sharing my knowledge.

At the time I was also in charge of the technical community growth, and organized the bi-weekly internal open conferences and katas.

work.summary:
I was in charge of building tools for our internal users and improving our customer flow by focusing on our needs and identifying areas of improvement in how we work.

I was also helping the team grow by sharing good practices around OOP design, testing strategies, and API design. I introduced Domain Driven Design in the company and had a crucial role in creating a learning organisation. I helped set up learning spaces such as code katas and was the host of the bimonthly internal conferences for tech teams for almost my whole time in the company.

This led me to start talking at conferences as well on testing and code quality subjects.

projects.name: Speaker
projects.description: I enjoy sharing ideas with others and have had the opportunity to speak at various events in France.
highlights: De CRUD à DDD pas à pas: Transitioning from a CRUD application developed with RAD tooling to a more business-oriented system.
Faire grandir une équipe technique: Sharing some of the strategies we've employed at Evaneos to scale the tech team from 5 to 45 persons.
Les exceptions, oui, mais pas n'importe comment: Explaining my mental model on how we should deal with exceptions.
PhpStorm = <3: Demonstrating that mastering an IDE gives us superpowers when it comes to refactoring or writing boilerplate code.
Recette de tests: Explaining various strategies to create tests that are easier to understand and maintain.
Tester du legacy grâce à l'Approval Testing: Demonstrating that it's possible to add tests to a system even if it exhibits some random behaviors.
Vous n'avez pas besoin de ça: Discussing the complexity of our projects and sharing ideas to adapt the right level of complexity to the problem we're solving.
